reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me say that I booked this hotel a week before il Palio, and it was pretty much the only option. It was by far the least expensive place we stayed on our trip, and we came to this hotel from Residenza del Moro in Florence, so there was a huge drop in hotel class.
reviews.title: Good for budget travelers with a car (but not much else)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So take these facts into consideration when reading my review.
reviews.title: Unexpected find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is outside of the city walls, about 1 mile away from the city center. Not walkable TO the city due to the uphill, but there is a city bus stop out front, or a cab will take you there for 10 euros. The walk back is relatively fast (15 min or so), but hardly a pleasant promenade, as you're basically just walking on the side of the road.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location, Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're traveling with a car, the location is actually excellent, as you can drop it off at their free parking lot and explore the city, which is otherwise closed to cars.
reviews.title: Possibly unlucky with the room, which was poor
Great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel and the rooms are basic but clean, as would match a 2-3 star hotel. We had a small room with a bed and not much else. Breakfast is adequate. Pool is present, but not a place you might want to lounge at for a long time. A/C functional, parking lot accessible...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel located in the outer edge of the city. With a car you will have no problems to get by. Helpful service staff, the man at the door is one jolly man! He will give you any tips you need.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Lovely base to discover Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is plenty, with amazing pastries, fresh fruits, juices, cold meats and cheeses. Found that we were the only foreigners there during our stay, it seems to be popular between Italians.
reviews.title: fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was in very good condition. Good installations. Unfortunately we couldn't use the pool because we arrived too late. They have free parking.
reviews.title: Quiet spacious room, ten minute walk to Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend if you need a clean, simple place to stay in Siena. You will get a good start for your day with the delicious breakfast!
reviews.title: Good Hotel.. long walk up-hill to historic center..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have choosen this hotel, because there was free parking and a pool. The hotel was realy nice. We had a big, nice room with view of the pool and garden. The breakfast was also good. The location is perfect to visit Siena, the auto was safely parked and we moved on with public transportation. The bus-stop is just out side the frontdoor and the bus brings you to the city-center, which is up-hill. Overall, this hotel was better than expected.
reviews.title: Deserves an accolade

reviews.text: outside city walls and on busy road, but good soundproofing, comfortable , clean , good breakfast , good pool and poolside and very helpful staff . Bus to central city leaves every 15 mins from doorstep of hotel - but pleasant 20 minute walk otherwise. Would certainly return
reviews.title: excellent base for Siena and Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: easy access to highway and free parking behind the hotel (perfect for daytrips in Tuscany) About 15min per foot to downtown Siena. Bus stop to the main station in front of the hotel (about 30min!)
reviews.title: nice hotel with great local restaurant around the corner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: very spacious with view of pool and mountains (nice!). Huge bathroom. Decoration was a bit scarce, but everything was clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service / Food: Breakfast was fine - choice of breads, pastry, juices, fruits, jam, ham etc. The flavor of freshly baked croissants in the morning ... mmmh.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel for exploring Siena

reviews.text: The hotel did not have a restaurant, but 5min in direction of the city, there was a fantastic local osteria (or trattoria?) with big terrace at the corner of the street. We ate there twice - both times we were the only tourists. Food was great and inexpensive.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Nice, clean and comfortable Hotel. Comfy Pillows and friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: Nice comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: Spacious room and bathroom with a bath!!
reviews.title: A little bit out of town, but great winter rates and service

reviews.text: I didnt have breakfast as I left early both monrings i stayed here.
reviews.title: Very good for the price, but you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a luxury hotel, but it is nice and has everythuing you need for a reasonable price.Only thing that may be a slight negative is that it is on the motorway.When I looked at the map,I thought you could walk here but noooooooo. The bus however is right outside the hotel but be aware, that the buses from the centro stop at 8pm!! i found this out the hard way but it is only 8 euro for a taxi to the hotel from Piazza Gramschi..........Mini supermerecato is 2 mins walk away and a pizzeria as well..........
reviews.title: nice hotel in a good position with free parking

reviews.text: Having a car made staying at Hotel La Colonna a very enjoyable experience. Although a little bit out of town (at the bottom of the hill leading to the soccer stadium) we got a great winter rate (Euro 59 per night per room) which included breakfast and off street parking. The reception staff were very helpful in giving us directions for heading into Siena (hotel map, advice on parking given that there was a big soccer game the next day etc) and the rooms seemed newly renovated and were very clean. Breakfast was a continental affair - but there was plenty of it and fresh coffee if you didn' want to use the machine.
reviews.title: Parking and location
